title: Drawing, "Roof Sketch", July 3, 1857
medium: Recto:  Graphite, brush and white gouache on green paper
markings:
Recto: Stamped in ink, at lower left: Lugt 457d
Verso: Stamped in ink, at upper center: Lugt 457c
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper right:  July 3d, 57 / - Illinissa -;again, at center: Paramo / gold brown; again, at center right:  A recent storm had frosted many parts; again, at center right:  This day observed the tall grass in / great profusion -  It forms a conspicuous object / in nearly all the scenery from Guaranda to Quito / Also noticed today in Jacingua a church / with plastered roof etc. which covered with rich green moss was very picturesque; again, at lower right: 2; again, at lower far right:  2 Grey green and silvery moss / growing in matted masses contrasted / with the charred and blackened / rafters of the roof which project over the door -- higher up / rich green foliage cacti, etc. / grass.
description: Horizontal view of the two peaks, norte and sur, of Mount Iliniza at top; a grass study at central far right; and a roof corner at lower right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Roof Sketch", July 3, 1857.
July 3, 1857. Recto:  Graphite, brush and white gouache on green paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-259.
